Texto: 
noncontributory
the third portion of the duodenum never crosses the midline.  additionally, the ascending colon remains on the left side of the abdomen just distal to a normally located ileocecal junction in the rlq.  these findings are consistent with a malrotation.
malrotation
incidental malrotation of intestine
66 year old man for  followup of a renal lesion.
